thread.title: Enagás at the 1st Aragon Hydrogen Week
thread.title_full: Enagás at the 1st Aragon Hydrogen Week

author: Enagás
title: Enagás at the 1st Aragon Hydrogen Week
text:
The Aragon Hydrogen Foundation, in collaboration with the Government of Aragon, presents the first edition of the Aragon Hydrogen Week from March 10 to 14 in Zaragoza, bringing together industry experts to analyze the challenges of hydrogen.
On behalf of Enagás, Elena Hernando, Manager of Hydrogen Infrastructure Business Analysis and Development, will talk about the Spanish Hydrogen Backbone Network (March 10).
As part of this event, the fifth edition of RENMAD HIDRÓGENO will take place on March 12 and 13 in Zaragoza, covering topics such as regulation, integration into power grids, sustainable production, economies of scale, technological advancements, and key factors like demand and pricing for project viability.
María Junco, Enagás General Manager of System Technical Management, will participate in the panel discussion “Guarantee of origin schemes and sustainability certificates for renewable hydrogen” (March 13, 11:20 AM – 12:05 PM).
Additionally, Maite Nonay, Enagás Strategy and Planning Manager, will present “Advances in hydrogen infrastructure in Spain and Europe: Spanish network and H2med” (March 13, 1:10 PM – 1:30 PM).
Click here for more information.
